name: luxuriance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(usually of plants or hair) the quality of growing thickly, strongly, and well: Near the pass, junipers flourish in great beauty and luxuriance. The modestly simple buildings contrast with the luxuriance of the vegetation.
the quality of being pleasantly thick or full: His long hair has a voluminous luxuriance. The music was all radiance and luxuriance. See
luxuriant
More examplesFewer examplesThe jungle’s unrelieved luxuriance matted the landscape.Grasses add to the feeling of luxuriance and add a special grace when they sway about in the breeze.The size and luxuriance of a beard reflects the wearer's personality.
